properties.description: Graduated University of Tasmania, with Bachelor of Science in Zoology
Formative year of field work on seals at Macquarie Island Nature Reserve
Back to UTas for an Honours degree in Zoology, supervised by Dr Alistair Hobday

properties.chapter: Phd studies at The University of Queensland 2008-2011
properties.description: PhD in Biological Sciences, Conferred in 2012. Titled: Effects of climate change on marine ecosystems and potential management responses. Supervised by Prof Ant Richardson, Prof Hugh Possingham and Dr Beth Fulton

properties.chapter: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis
properties.source2-credit: Brown et al. Global Change Biology 2011
properties.description: Participated in an NCEAS working group on Marine Climate Change during my PhD, which was influential on my work on climate change

properties.chapter: Post-doc with the Global Change Institute, at the University of Queensland 2012-2014
properties.description: Post-doc on modelling Marine Protected Areas in the Coral Triangle with Prof. Peter Mumby

properties.chapter: Research fellowships at Australian Rivers Institute, Griffith University 2014-
properties.description: Post-doc with Griffith for one year before I received a Discovery Early Career Research Award (2016-2019, from the Australian Research Council) to study the effects of habitat change on fish at a global scale. Then a lectureship at Griffith's School of Environment 2019-
